Retrieved 11 May 2005.</ref> | noprose = yes }} '''''Schizophrenia''''' is the second studio album by [[Brazil]]ian [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] band [[Sepultura]], released in 1987 through [[Cogumelo Records]]. It is the first album for the band with [[Andreas Kisser]]. The album's sound leans more towards the thrash metal genre than the previous album ''[[Morbid Visions]]'', which is closer to death metal. All songs were recorded during August 1987, except for the bonus track "Troops of Doom" which was recorded during August 26â€“27, 1990. In America the band sent radio playlists at a time when they were struggling to book gigs because club owners were afraid to book them due to their style.<ref name="Phoenix Times 1993-05-12">{{cite news|last=Baird|first=Robert|title=The Boys from Brazil Transplanted to Phoenix, Sepultura Strives for Death Metal with a Conscience|url=http://www.phoenixnewtimes.com/content/printVersion/160396|accessdate=2010-08-03|newspaper=Phoenix New Times|date=1993-05-12}}</ref> [[Roadrunner Records]] signed them and released ''Schizophrenia'' internationally before seeing the band perform in person.<ref name="MTV">{{cite web|title=Sepultura|url=http://www.mtv.com/music/artist/sepultura/artist.jhtml#biographyEnd|publisher=MTV|accessdate=August 2, 2010}}</ref><ref name="Colon 1991-08-07">{{cite news|last=Colon|first=Suzan|title=Name That Tomb|url=http://www.miaminewtimes.com/content/printVersion/233397|accessdate=2010-08-02|newspaper=Miami New Times|date=1991-08-01}}</ref> ==Musical style== Kisser states that, when he joined Sepultura in '87, he {{cquote|...brought in some new influences - traditional heavy metal and a more melodic style. It was an immediate meeting of minds.
